contents: Volcanoes (11) <u>can be destructive, extremely</u>. Sukurajima Volcano, located in southern Japan about 950 kilometers from Tokyo, erupted for the 500th time in August of 2013. The explosive eruption left the city of Kagoshima covered with volcanic ash. It caused train delays and poor visibility, and it forced residents to use masks and umbrellas to protect themselves from the ash.
